I've spent the last decade working in tech as a product manager and software engineer. I'm now taking some time off to explore my interest in philosophy and the arts. I plan to share my thoughts and exporations here. Some will be more logical arguments in the form of essays, others more artistic in the form of poetry and short fiction.

Topics will likely be all over the place, but I tend to think a lot about political systems, economics, and the philosophy of science, particularly what these subjects reveal about human nature.

Essays

Stocks have no intrinsic value

It is often taught in business school and preached by fund managers that stocks are essentially pieces of a business which has some intrinsic value. The investor need only purchase the stock when its market price is below a conservatively calculated valuation. I challenge this widely held belief and propose that all value is strictly extrinsic.
